alert.note: Alert for Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 8:34PM EDT until September 30 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Rowan. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM EDT, The threat for additional heavy tropical showers will continue through late evening and rainfall could accumulate up to 2.5 or 3 inches in spots, pretty much anywhere in the county. Stream levels countywide will continue to rise and perhaps begin flooding low-lying areas. Also watch out for high water issues as well, especially along the I-85 corridor. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kannapolis, Salisbury, China Grove, Spencer, Landis, Enochville, Granite Quarry, Rockwell, Cleveland, Faith, High Rock Lake, Piedmont Research Station, Woodleaf, Mount Ulla and Gold Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
